- Add package.json with all dependencies
- Configure TypeScript with strict mode
- Set up ESLint and Prettier
- Add PWA manifest and next-pwa config
- Configure Jest and Playwright for testing
- Add .gitignore and .env.example")

- Add complete setup guide with step-by-step instructions
- Add Supabase setup guide (dev + test projects)
- Add Google OAuth Console setup guide
- Add Razorpay setup and webhook configuration guide
- Add migrations guide with rollback procedures
- Add API endpoint documentation with examples
- Add architecture overview and system design docs")

Bash(git commit -m "migrations: add core database schema (001-004)

- 001: Create core tables (organizations, users, clients, sites, assets)
- 002: Create jobs and assignments tables with check-in/out tracking
- 003: Create inventory tables with optional serial number support
- 004: Add triggers (updated_at, audit logging, usage counters) and validation functions

Each migration includes up and down (rollback) SQL files")

Bash(git commit -m "migrations: add RLS policies and payment/subscription tables (005-008)

- 005: Add comprehensive RLS policies for org isolation and role-based access
- 006: Add auth field enhancements and indexes
- 007: Create subscription plans, billing customers, payments, and usage counters
- 008: Add RLS policies for billing tables (owner-only access)

All migrations include rollback scripts")

Bash(git commit -m "seeds: add comprehensive demo data for Sharma Services

- 001: Free and Pro subscription plans
- 002: Demo organization (Sharma Services)
- 003: 4 demo users (owner, coordinator, 2 technicians)
- 004: Complete demo data (3 clients, 8 sites, 10 assets, 10 jobs with assignments, 8 inventory items)
- 005: Billing setup with active Pro subscription and usage counters

All seed files are idempotent and include verification queries")

Bash(git commit -m "chore: add development scripts for migrations, seeds, and setup

- migrate.sh: Run database migrations with dry-run support
- seed.sh: Run seed scripts to populate demo data
- reset-db.sh: Destructive DB reset with confirmation
- rollback.sh: Rollback last migration
- dev.sh: One-command setup (install, migrate, seed, start)

All scripts include error handling and colored output")
